Package ohos.security.seckeychain

Class SecKeyChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.security.seckeychain.SecKeyChain

  • public class SecKeyChain
extends Object
    Provides methods for installing, selecting, and using private keys and their certificate chains.

    An application can install new private keys and certificates through the Intent obtained using getInstallationIntent(), and select the default private key and certificate using selectSecPrivateKey(ohos.app.AbilityContext,java.lang.String[],java.security.Principal[],ohos.utils.net.Uri,ohos.security.seckeychain.SecKeyAliasCallback,java.lang.String).

    All applications can obtain trusted private keys and certificates through the X509KeyManager by calling getSecPrivateKey(ohos.app.AbilityContext, java.lang.String) and getSecCertificateChain(ohos.app.AbilityContext, java.lang.String).

    Since:
    3
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Security.Seckeychain

      • SPEC_CERTIFICATE

        public static final String SPEC_CERTIFICATE
        Indicates the flag to specify the X.509 certificate to install. The format of the X.509 certificate must be a PEM or ASN.1 DER encoded byte array.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SecKeyChain

        public SecKeyChain​()

    • Method Detail

      • selectSecPrivateKey

        public static void selectSecPrivateKey​(AbilityContext ability,
                                       String[] secKeyTypes,
                                       Principal[] issuers,
                                       String host,
                                       int port,
                                       SecKeyAliasCallback callback,
                                       String secKeyAlias)
        Starts an ability of available certificates (the host and port can be specified) for users to select the private key and certificate for authentication.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the ability to start. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyTypes - Indicates the type of the asymmetric key matching the certificate to select. The value can be null, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_RSA, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_EC, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_AES, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA1, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA224, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA256, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA384, or KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA512.
        issuers - Indicates the issuer of the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        host - Indicates the host name of the service provider matching the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        port - Indicates the port number of the service provider's host matching the certificate to select. If this parameter is not specified, the value -1 is used.
        callback - Indicates the callback through which the selected certificate and private key alias will be returned. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyAlias - Indicates the alias of the private key matching the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        Since:
        3

      • selectSecPrivateKey

        public static void selectSecPrivateKey​(AbilityContext ability,
                                       String[] secKeyTypes,
                                       Principal[] issuers,
                                       Uri uri,
                                       SecKeyAliasCallback callback,
                                       String secKeyAlias)
        Starts an ability of available certificates (the URI can be specified) for users to select the private key and certificate for authentication.
        Parameters:
        ability - Indicates the ability to start. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyTypes - Indicates the type of the asymmetric key matching the certificate to select. The value can be null, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_RSA, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_EC, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_AES, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA1, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA224, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA256, KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA384, or KeyStoreConstants.SEC_KEY_ALGORITHM_HMAC_SHA512.
        issuers - Indicates the issuer of the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        uri - Indicates the URI of the service provider matching the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        callback - Indicates the callback through which the selected certificate and private key alias will be returned. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyAlias - Indicates the alias of the private key matching the certificate to select. The value may be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the issuer is not of the X500Principal type.
        Since:
        3

      • getInstallationIntent

        public static Intent getInstallationIntent​()
        Obtains an Intent used to install certificates.

        You can specify the X.509 (whose encoded form can be obtained using X509Certificate#getEncoded) or PKCS#12 certificates to install and their aliases in the Intent.

        Returns:
        Returns the Intent used to install certificates, which cannot be null.
        Since:
        3

      • getSecCertificateChain

        public static X509Certificate[] getSecCertificateChain​(AbilityContext context,
                                                       String secKeyAlias)
                                                throws InterruptedException,
                                                       SecKeyChainException
        Obtains the secure certificate chain matching a specified private key alias.

        If the private key alias does not exist in the system, or the caller does not have permissions to access the private key alias, this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyAlias - Indicates the private key alias. The value cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns the secure certificate chain matching the specified private key alias. The value can be null.
        Throws:
        SecKeyChainException - Throws this exception if there is a problem with the private key or certificate.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this method is called from the main thread.
        InterruptedException - Throws this exception if the current thread is interrupted by other threads.
        Since:
        3

      • getSecPrivateKey

        public static PrivateKey getSecPrivateKey​(AbilityContext context,
                                          String secKeyAlias)
                                   throws InterruptedException,
                                          SecKeyChainException
        Obtains the private key with a specified alias.

        If the private key alias does not exist in the system, or the caller does not have permissions to access the alias, this method returns null.

        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context. The value cannot be null.
        secKeyAlias - Indicates the private key alias. The value cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns the private key with the specified alias. The value can be null.
        Throws:
        SecKeyChainException - Throws this exception if there is a problem with the private key or certificate.
        IllegalStateException - Throws this exception if this method is called from the main thread.
        InterruptedException - Throws this exception if the current thread is interrupted by other threads.
        Since:
        3

      • isSupported

        public static boolean isSupported​(String secKeyAlgorithm)
        Checks whether private keys indicated by a specified secKeyAlgorithm are supported.
        Parameters:
        secKeyAlgorithm - Indicates the private key type (for example, RSA) to check. The value cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if private keys indicated by the specified secKeyAlgorithm are supported; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
